page.title: 04BEMPTON & BUCKTON-PASTIMES
page.content: Recreation for the young and old is quite high on the list of local priorities. For some years now land has been sought to provide a{playing {field}so that football, tennis, cricket,bowls etc. can be made available. At present there is a thriving football club who play on a field at Buckton. Unfortunately the field, owned by local farmer Mr. Tony Towse, has to accommodate sheep for part of the year. There are a number of other clubs; for the younger element there are{Beavers, Cubs, Brownies }and a { {Youth Club.}For older residents we have a{Snooker}club, {Women's {Institute}, {Mother's Union}and an { {Over Sixties} club.
